summary: Email correspondence between Rita M. Glavin and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the Office of Professional Responsibility's separate investigation into the original Jeffrey Epstein plea deal. The OPR may contact Glavin to ask limited questions about victims' experiences, including those of Ms. Robson.

persons.name: Rita M. Glavin
persons.context: Attorney who is being notified that the DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility may contact her regarding their investigation into the original Epstein plea deal, potentially to ask about victims including Ms. Robson.

persons.name: Laura Ingersoll
persons.context: Identified as the OPR counsel who may reach out to Rita Glavin as part of the OPR's investigation into the Epstein plea deal. Glavin notes she worked with Ingersoll 20 years prior.

persons.name: Jeffrey Ragsdale
persons.context: Identified as the current acting director of the DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility at the time of the email.

persons.name: Alex
persons.role: Assistant U.S. Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: The federal prosecutor who sends the initial heads-up email to Rita Glavin about the OPR's separate investigation into the Epstein plea deal.

persons.name: Ms. Robson
persons.context: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein mentioned as someone the OPR may ask about regarding her experiences during the original investigation.

persons.name: Judge Vyskocil
persons.context: Mentioned in a humorous aside by Glavin regarding a teleconference for a horse racing indictment.

connections.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Alex provides a heads-up to attorney Glavin about a potential OPR inquiry related to the Epstein case.
Glavin states she worked with Ingersoll 20 years ago when Glavin was at the Public Integrity section.
Alex's email indicates the OPR investigation may involve asking about victim Ms. Robson's experiences.
Both are associated with the DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility; Ragsdale as acting director, Ingersoll as counsel.

events.title: OPR Investigation Notification
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Alex emails Rita Glavin to give a heads-up that the DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility may contact her as part of their investigation into the original Epstein plea deal.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) was conducting its own investigation into the original Jeffrey Epstein plea deal, separate from other ongoing investigations.
OPR's investigation involved looking into the circumstances of the initial Epstein investigation and potentially asking about victims' experiences, including those of Ms. Robson.
The communication reveals professional coordination and courtesy notifications between a federal prosecutor and a private attorney regarding a separate internal DOJ inquiry.
The correspondence is dated April 2020, indicating investigative activity related to Epstein continued well after his death in August 2019.
